<a id="VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D"></a>

# VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D

**Inherits:** [Node2D](Node2D.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [VisibleOnScreenEnabler2D](VisibleOnScreenEnabler2D.md)

A rectangular region of 2D space that detects whether it is visible on screen.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D** represents a rectangular region of 2D space. When any part of this region becomes visible on screen or in a viewport, it will emit a [screen_entered](VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D.md#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_signal_screen_entered) signal, and likewise it will emit a [screen_exited](VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D.md#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_signal_screen_exited) signal when no part of it remains visible.

If you want a node to be enabled automatically when this region is visible on screen, use [VisibleOnScreenEnabler2D](VisibleOnScreenEnabler2D.md).

\ **Note:** **VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D** uses the render culling code to determine whether it's visible on screen, so it won't function unless [CanvasItem.visible](CanvasItem.md#CanvasItem_property_visible) is set to ``true``.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [2D Dodge The Creeps Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2712)

Emitted when the VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D enters the screen.

## Property Descriptions

<a id="VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_property_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Rect2](Rect2.md) **rect** = `Rect2(-10, -10, 20, 20)` [ðŸ”—](#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_property_rect)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rect**\ (\ value\: [Rect2](Rect2.md)\ )
- [Rect2](Rect2.md) **get_rect**\ (\ )

The VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D's bounding rectangle.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_property_show_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **show_rect** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_property_show_rect)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_show_rect**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_showing_rect**\ (\ )

If ``true``, shows the rectangle area of [rect](VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D.md#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_property_rect) in the editor with a translucent magenta fill. Unlike changing the visibility of the VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D, this does not affect the screen culling detection.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_method_is_on_screen"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_on_screen**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D_method_is_on_screen)

If ``true``, the bounding rectangle is on the screen.

\ **Note:** It takes one frame for the **VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D**'s visibility to be determined once added to the scene tree, so this method will always return ``false`` right after it is instantiated, before the draw pass.
